title: Another Weird Nintendo Decision?!
description:
Just put it on Spotify :-( 

From this episode of KFGD: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DpEiFlJYzTk Phasmophobia is out now PS5, PS VR2, and Xbox Series X|S on October 29.
PlayStation: https://store.playstation.com/en-us/concept/10005673
Xbox: https://www.xbox.com/en-US/games/store/phasmophobia-game-preview/9N6D60SBZN05/0010
New World Aeternum is available now on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S and PC! Get it here: https://bit.ly/3XROcCT"


FOLLOW US ON EVERYWHERE!

transcript_chunks.text: Nintendo made a music streaming app for the switch online subscribers I'm pulling from Andrew Webster at The Verge while we all wait for the reval of Nintendo's next console the company has once again announced something very different this time it's a mobile app called Nintendo music which lets users listen to classic gaming Tunes from Nintendo gam spanning the last few decades including Splatoon Animal Crossing and The Legend of Zelda it's only available to switch online subscribers and it's launching today on both IOS and Android the app features curated playlists themed around games moments moods or characters though you can also build your own it also supports streaming as well as downloading tracks for offline listening curiously it includes a spoiler feature that lets you filter out tracks that somehow might spoil a game you haven't played or finished yet and if you just want some high rule White Noise the the app also lets you Loop songs or extend select tracks to 15 30 or 60
